1.text: ‘Come, and we turn back unto Jehovah, For He hath torn, and He doth heal us, He doth smite, and He bindeth us up.

2.text: He doth revive us after two days, In the third day He doth raise us up, And we live before Him.

3.text: And we know—we pursue to know Jehovah, As the dawn prepared is His going forth, And He cometh in as a shower to us, As gathered rain—sprinkling earth.’

4.text: What do I do to thee, O Ephraim? What do I do to thee, O Judah? Your goodness is as a cloud of the morning, And as dew rising early—going.

5.text: Therefore I have hewed by prophets, I have slain them by sayings of My mouth, And My judgments to the light goeth forth.

6.text: For kindness I desired, and not sacrifice, And a knowledge of God above burnt-offerings.

7.text: And they, as Adam, transgressed a covenant, There they dealt treacherously against me.

8.text: Gilead is a city of workers of iniquity, Slippery from blood.

9.text: And as bands do wait for a man, A company of priests do murder—the way to Shechem, For wickedness they have done.

10.text: In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing, There is the whoredom of Ephraim—defiled is Israel.

11.text: Also, O Judah, appointed is a harvest to thee, In My turning back to the captivity of My people!
